meanings.definition: Having a notched or zigzag edge.
meanings.sent1: The engrailed border of the tablecloth added a charming touch to the dining table.
meanings.sent2: The engrailed design on the curtains gave the room a unique look.
meanings.sent3: The engrailed pattern on the socks made them look like little waves.
meanings.sent4: The engrailed outline of the clouds in the sky resembled a child's drawing.
meanings.sent5: The engrailed fence along the garden was both decorative and functional.

meanings.definition: To decorate or ornament with a notched or zigzag pattern.
meanings.sent1: She engrailed the edges of the paper with colorful markers.
meanings.sent2: The artist engrailed the frame of the painting to give it a unique border.
meanings.sent3: He engrailed the cake with intricate patterns using icing.
meanings.sent4: The tailor engrailed the hem of the dress with delicate embroidery.
meanings.sent5: The carpenter engrailed the wooden box with precision and care.
